goal.ch: 組織工程是一門跨領域學科，將工程原理融合生命科學知識，應用在修補、維持或改善組織功能的各式生物替代物的開發中。再生醫學結合了組織工程學和生物材料技術，可以完成細胞，組織或器官的修復過程。對於人類而言，我們再生治療的最終目標是開發功能全面的生物工程器官，以替代因疾病，損傷或衰老而丟失或受損的器官。但是，到目前為止，還沒有完善的技術來實現功能正常的器官的3D重建。此外，在2019年，美國環境保護署（EPA）指示該機構積極減少動物試驗，包括減少哺乳動物的研究要求，並在2025年之前將資助減少30％，並在2035年之前完全消除它們。動物替代已成為一個緊迫而關鍵的問題。在本課程中，我們將介紹組織工程學和再生醫學的基礎，還將討論如何開發體外測試平台，以結束對傳統動物測試作為人類和環境風險預測指標的數十年依賴。
goal.en: Since 2019, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has directed its agencies to actively reduce animal testing. This includes decreasing the demand for mammalian studies and planning a 30％ reduction in funding by 2025, with a complete cessation of animal testing by 2035. As a result, finding alternatives to animal testing has become both urgent and important. Tissue engineering is a multidisciplinary field that combines engineering and life sciences, while regenerative medicine is an integration of tissue engineering and biomaterial technology. The ultimate goal is to create fully functional bioengineered organs to replace those lost or damaged due to disease, injury, or aging. In this course, we will not only explore the fundamentals of tissue engineering and regenerative medicine but also discuss how to utilize in vitro culturing techniques to develop Non-Animal Models (NAMs). This aims to end the decades-long reliance on traditional animal testing in human and environmental risk assessment.
